message: the idea of averaging over numerous robust and orthogonal models on random subspaces seems to naturally flow from bootstrapping and combining unrelated predictive models.

Jeremy HOWARD (who was semi-finalist at several Kaggle competitions, and now their "Data Scientist") gaves a brief overview of his “toolbox” (using a few Kaggle competitions as practical examples), and also provides an introduction to ensembles of decision trees (including the well-known Random Forest algorithm):  http://media.kaggle.com/MelbURN.html -- nice screencast.
